Offense: Pivots the military towards offensive stances. Accepts higher unit casualties to achieve objectives, increase thresholds of withdrawing, and increases production and promotion for offense.
Defense: Pivots the military towards defensive stances. Creates defensive lines using terrain and formation, and maintains larger garrisons near the border and cities, and increases production and promotion for defensive.
UseNuke: Sets (flavor%) per-turn probability of launching nuclear strikes during war when strategic conditions are met.
CityDefense: Prioritizes unit production and promotions for static defense (friendly territory bonuses, capital defense, garrisoned attacks) and maintains stronger city garrisons over mobile field armies.
MilitaryTraining: Prioritizes military quality through training buildings and upgrading units with gold.
Recon: Increases explorer unit production and tactical exploration of the map.
Ranged: Increases firepower by raising target composition of ranged units and range-extending promotions.
Mobile: Increases mobility and maneuverability by raising target composition of mobile units and prioritizes related promotions.
Nuke: Increases nuclear weapon arsenals for strategic deterrence.
Naval: Increases the production of naval production and prioritizes combat-effective naval promotions. Naval size is also based on coastal city percentage and geography.
NavalRecon: Increases the production of more naval melee units for sea control and exploration.
Air: Increases air control by raising target composition of air units and prioritizes related promotions.
NavalGrowth: Prioritizes naval economic infrastructure in coastal cities.
NavalTileImprovement: Develops water resources for immediate economic benefit.
AirCarrier: Increases carrier production to support air operations. Triggers carrier production when aircraft lack sufficient capacity
AntiAir: Maintains anti-air unit ratio to counter enemy aircraft. Activates anti-air strategy when enemy air detected and ratio falls below threshold
Airlift: Influences troop deployment strategy through airlift infrastructure. High values favor centralized reserves with rapid deployment; low values favor forward garrisons
Expansion: Balances expansion with military priorities during wartime. Wartime heavily penalizes expansion, forcing resources toward military units
Growth: Balances population growth with military production needs. Wartime reduces flavor, deprioritizing food tiles and growth infrastructure for military production
TileImprovement: Emphasizes peaceful economic development over military concerns. Increases worker bullying from city-states and reduces barbarian eradication priority
Infrastructure: Prioritizes road building and city connections for economic efficiency. Wartime reduces flavor, deprioritizing infrastructure for military concerns
Production: Emphasizes production output over other yields. Workers prioritize mines and lumber mills, cities work hill tiles, wartime increases flavor for faster unit production
WaterConnection: Prioritizes harbor construction for trade route connectivity. Economic infrastructure focus, not tactical
Gold: Influences gold spending priorities during warfare. May purchase military units for immediate deployment rather than building them
Science: Advances through tech tree for superior military units. Strategic advantage through earlier access to advanced technologies, not tactical behavior change
Culture: Does not impact tactical AI decisions. Only affects strategic choices like victory pursuit and city specialization
Happiness: Does not directly impact tactical decisions. Affects building priorities and economic choices with wartime modifiers
GreatPeople: Does not impact tactical decisions. Influences infrastructure choices for specialist buildings and great person generation
Wonder: Balances wonder construction with military survival priorities. Reduces wonder production during defensive crises and wartime
Religion: Does not impact tactical decisions. Only affects strategic planning, religious strategy, and diplomatic behavior
Diplomacy: Does not impact tactical combat. Controls diplomatic unit production and city-state investment, heavily penalized during warfare
Spaceship: Does not impact tactical decisions. Exclusively governs strategic late-game science victory choices
Espionage: Prioritizes counterintelligence in high-value science cities. High values protect top 50% science cities; low values protect only top 15%
